RESPONDENT (S)' ANNEXURE: NIL //TRUE COPY// P.S.TO JUDGE Msv/ bs ; : 2016/KER/34134 RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.Y, J Dated this the 4" day of August, 2016 ORDER 1.As per order dated 6.8.2015 in Crl.R.P.No.711 of 2003, this Court after maintaining the conviction imposed against the petitioner had modified the sentence and the petitioner was sentenced to undergo imprisonment till the rising of the Court and to pay a compensation of Rs.5,000/-. Two months time was granted to deposit the compensation amount before the trial court with a default clause. 2.It is submitted by the learned counsel appearing for the petitioner that the petitioner is abroad and he will be permitted to relieve himself from his employment only in the month of August. The learned counsel prays that he be permitted to appear before court below on a day between 10.8.2016 and 20.8.2016 to suffer the sentence bs : : 2016/KER/34134 Cri.M.C.4954/2016 2 and to pay the compensation amount. The learned counsel also relies on the judgment of this Court in K.G.Girish Kumar v. Muthoot Capital Services Pvt. Litd.(2007 (4) KLT 16) and Subash Sait v. Sree Gokulam Chits and Finances, Palakkad & Another (2015(4) KLT 497) to contend that this Court in appropriate cases have exercised powers under section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure had granted the relief. I am convinced of the reasons stated and I am of the view that the time granted as per order dated 6.8.2015 can be extended by a period of two weeks to secure the ends of justice. 3.Accordingly, the time granted as per order dated 6.8.2015 in Crl.R.P.No.711 of 2003 is extended by a period of two weeks from today. Petition is disposed of. Sd/- RAJA VIJAYARAGHAVAN.YV. JUDGE vps
